title: Las Vegas Sands Stock Dips After the Casino Operator Reports Light Revenue
text:
Las Vegas Sands stock was edging lower in after-hours trading Wednesday, following the casino operator’s third-quarter earnings report.

The back story. Las Vegas Sands shares (ticker: LVS) have gained 13.7% since January, trailing the S&P 500’s nearly 20% gain and a 22.5% rise for the Consumer Discretionary Select Sector SPDR exchange traded fund (XLY). Like many of its gaming peers, Las Vegas Sands has struggled with the effects of the U.S.-China trade war. As the tariff dispute drags on, its negative impact on the...
description: The gaming company met Wall Street’s expectations on earnings per share and revived revenue somewhat since last year, but shares slid. Blame the trade war, among other pressures.
